title: Hamza2424
author: Hamza2424

comments.author: mk4
comments.body: We don't need to motivate the new peeps. If they actually need motivation or inspiration to be able to strive, maybe they shouldn't need to be here in the first place. People who grew to be actual bitcoiners are the ones who go here with genuine interest; not those who just want to do bounties.

comments.author: Lucius
comments.body: I would like you to find the motivation to learn how to make life on the forum easier for all members - and I mean your oversized pictures, which are quite irritating to me (and to many other members). Slow internet connection and limited data traffic are a daily reality for some.Thought of the day: It's not all about merits on the forum.

comments.author: BIT-BENDER
comments.body: The best motivation any newbie can get is the one they give to themselves, no success story begins with outside motivation it begins when a person decides they want to change or want to seek for ways to change, then their inner self it targeted towards that and then only then can any external motivation bear fruits so to those who are has already channeled themselves towards positive change then my first motivation is take things easy and do your reading and research.

comments.author: sheenshane
comments.body: Newcomers not only motivated how to rank up, but they should also learn first how forum works and the next blockchain technology especially in Bitcoin.If you've learned all of these, merit isn't a barrier for you to rank up and it will unknowingly come to you.Quote from: Lucius on July 22, 2022, 01:47:46 PMThought of the day: It's not all about merits on the forum.I tend to agree with this, the forum isn't about merit, sometimes we figure out how useful to us that forum sharpens our mind to be knowledgeable in crypto.

comments.author: Dave1
comments.body: Yes, for beginners, it should not be about merit, just simply browsing the community is already an experience reading those threads and reply by those who have knowledge and learning from them.And then maybe those merits will come along, as you gained that grasp and understanding. Members will recognized you then and then you will received your merits.

comments.author: Darker45
comments.body: Progress here shouldn't be measured by merits. Neither should it be measured by rank. Rather, it should be measured by how vast and deep your Bitcoin knowledge and understanding have grown since you came here. Merit and rank are shallow motivations so to speak. A newbie who remains a newbie after a year, who has only made a handful of posts, but has read a lot of discussions on various topics, made further research on them, and deeply understood them is a forum member much more motivated and better than me, a legendary, and many others with higher ranks and with more merits.

comments.author: cryptoaddictchie
comments.body: Im shy to post mine cause isnt that attractive though. Like others said it should not be bragged here and having motivation threads with merits display is somehow feel boastful by others. Apparently we can check other's achievement by visiting their profile to see how many merits they received from their contributions.Also the merits are being removed on the display for limited of 120days. Its just show how he did received merits constantly.A success story isnt bad but in this way its not being done properly.

comments.author: Daniel91
comments.body: Quote from: sheenshane on July 22, 2022, 11:52:35 PMNewcomers not only motivated how to rank up, but they should also learn first how forum works and the next blockchain technology especially in Bitcoin.If you've learned all of these, merit isn't a barrier for you to rank up and it will unknowingly come to you.Quote from: Lucius on July 22, 2022, 01:47:46 PMThought of the day: It's not all about merits on the forum.I tend to agree with this, the forum isn't about merit, sometimes we figure out how useful to us that forum sharpens our mind to be knowledgeable in crypto.I can definitely agree with this.This forum is a community of crypto enthusiasts, a place for free discussion, seeking answers to various questions, presenting new crypto projects etc.On this forum you can meet people from your local communities, and even meet in person, which was also my personal experience, one of the best in my life.I think that for new members, the main motivation for registering on this forum should be to learn something, meet members of their local crypto community, and with more knowledge and experience later participate in some paid crypto projects on this forum.Unfortunately, I am aware that for most new members this is not a motivation and I don't think there is much we can do to change that.

comments.author: Dunamisx
comments.body: I want to believe this thread will not be misconcepted by newbies to begin for merits hunt indescriminately, this is how i perceive it in the first place, a newbie should learn and grow with the full knowledge and understandings of bitcoin, cryptocurrency and the forum, this will lead them to personal discoveries like this one, there are some learning that we acquire unintentionally which are often associated with learning and growth experience, when a newbie is interested in knowing by reading and learning then they will surely come across the discovery of interesting threads that could help in this manner. We have to as well consider some newbie not having the intention of staying, ones they got their challenges solved they remains inactive or left, so this may not necessarily be applicable to all newbies.
